Handles missing products gracefully with `if (!product) return null` (line 181). | | GuideViewer modal works with all guide sections | **MET** | Properly renders sections with navigation (lines 854-896), section switching, progress tracking, and all content types (tips, warnings, media, products). | | MediaRenderer handles all media types | **PARTIALLY MET** | Handles `gif` and `image` types correctly (lines 135-156). **Video type is declared in types but NOT implemented in MediaRenderer.** | | Region-aware pricing displays correctly | **MET** | Uses `useRegion()` hook for `getLink()` function. Price formatting is available via `formatAmount` and `formatRange` methods. | ### 2. Region Context (`/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/contexts/RegionContext.tsx`) | Requirement | Status | Details | |-------------|--------|---------| | All 6 regions supported | **MET** | Regions `us`, `uk`, `de`, `fr`, `au`, `asia` are all defined in `REGION_CONFIGS` (lines 22-77 of types file). | | Price formatting works for all currencies | **MET** | `formatPrice()` and `formatPriceRange()` functions handle all currencies (USD, GBP, EUR, AUD) with proper symbols. | | Auto-detection logic is correct | **MET** | Priority order is correct: localStorage -> navigator.language -> timezone -> default (lines 25-82 of region.ts). Handles partial locale matches and continent-based timezone fallbacks. | ### 3. Type Safety (`/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/types/guides.ts`) | Requirement | Status | Details | |-------------|--------|---------| | GuideProduct interface has all required fields | **MET** | Contains: `id`, `name`, `brand?`, `category`, `tagline`, `description`, `priority`, `priceRange?`, `regionLinks`, `directLink?`, `imageUrl?`, `isBaseStack?` (lines 105-122). | | ProductCategory union includes all categories | **MET** | Includes 11 categories: `hygiene`, `grooming`, `skincare`, `miscellaneous`, `supplements`, `hair`, `beard`, `teeth`, `kbeauty`, `hormonal`, `surgery` (lines 83-94). | | Guide interface includes productIds array | **MET** | `productIds?: string[]` is defined on line 172. | ### 4. Index Exports (`/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/data/guides/index.ts`) | Requirement | Status | Details | |-------------|--------|---------| | All guides are exported | **MET** | 58+ guides exported across 13 categories. All imports and exports properly configured. | | All helper functions are exported | **MET** | Exports include: `getGuideById`, `getGuideBySlug`, `getGuidesByCategory`, `getRelatedGuides`, `searchGuides`, `getTotalGuideCount`, `getTotalReadTime`, `getAllGuideProductIds`, `getGuidesByGender`, `getCategoryById`, `getAllCategoryIds`. | | `getGuideProductById`, `getGuideProductsByIds` work correctly | **MET** | Both functions are exported from `products-registry.ts` and re-exported from index. `getGuideProductById` supports aliases for backwards compatibility. | --- ## Detailed Findings ### Issue 1: Video Media Type Not Implemented (Medium Priority) **File**: `/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/components/results/tabs/GuidesTab.tsx` **Description**: The `MediaType` union in types includes `'video'`, but the `MediaRenderer` component only handles `gif` and `image` types. If a guide contains a video media item, it will be rendered as an image (fallback behavior). **Code Location**: Lines 79-164 of GuidesTab.tsx **Current Behavior**: ```typescript const isGif = media.type === 'gif' || media.url.endsWith('.gif'); // No check for media.type === 'video' ``` **Recommendation**: Add video rendering support: ```typescript if (media.type === 'video') { return ( ); } ``` --- ### Issue 2: No Loading State for ProductCallout Image (Low Priority) **File**: `/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/components/results/tabs/GuidesTab.tsx` **Description**: The ProductCallout component has loading state logic but does not show the loading spinner until the condition `isLoading && !hasError && product.imageUrl` is met. This is functionally correct but could be simplified. **Code Location**: Lines 189-194 **Current Behavior**: Works correctly. No action required unless code simplification is desired. --- ### Issue 3: Fallback Link Returns `'#'` (Low Priority) **File**: `/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/lib/region.ts` **Description**: When no product links are available for any region and no direct link exists, the function returns `'#'` which is a non-functional link. **Code Location**: Line 161 **Current Behavior**: ```typescript return firstAvailable || '#'; ``` **Recommendation**: Consider logging a warning in development or returning a more informative fallback (e.g., a search URL for the product name). --- ### Issue 4: Price Formatting Does Not Convert Currencies (Low Priority) **File**: `/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/lib/region.ts` **Description**: The `formatPrice()` function only adds the currency symbol - it does not convert USD prices to local currency equivalents. All products have prices defined in USD. **Code Location**: Lines 222-228 **Current Behavior**: A product with `priceRange: { min: 20, max: 30, currency: 'USD' }` will display as "20.00 - 30.00" regardless of region, but with the region's currency symbol (e.g., "20.00 - 30.00" for UK users). This could be confusing. **Recommendation**: Either: 1. Add currency conversion rates for display purposes 2. Clearly indicate "Prices in USD" when the product currency differs from user's region 3. Store prices in multiple currencies per product --- ## Quality Issues Beyond Requirements ### 1. ESLint Warnings (Info) The codebase has minor ESLint warnings (not related to guides): - Missing hook dependencies in `LandmarkAnalysisTool.tsx` - `` usage instead of `` in some components ### 2. TypeScript Compilation (Pass) TypeScript compilation passes with no errors. All types are properly defined and used. ### 3. Error Handling (Good) - `MediaRenderer` has proper error states with graceful fallback UI - `ProductCallout` handles missing products with early return - Region detection has try-catch blocks for localStorage and Intl API failures ### 4. Accessibility (Partial) - Alt text is properly passed to images - No ARIA labels on interactive elements in the guide navigation - Keyboard navigation not explicitly tested --- ## Recommendations Summary | Priority | Issue | Recommendation | |----------|-------|----------------| | **Medium** | Video media type not implemented | Add `

# QA Validation Report: Guides Product System for Affiliate Readiness

## Overall Verdict: **PASS WITH ISSUES**

---

## Requirements Checklist

### 1. Product Registry Completeness

| Requirement | Status | Details |
|-------------|--------|---------|
| Every product has `id` | **Met** | All 73 products have unique IDs |
| Every product has `name` | **Met** | All products have names |
| Every product has `brand` | **Met** | All products have brand field (optional per type) |
| Every product has `category` | **Met** | All products have valid categories from 11 allowed values |
| Every product has `tagline` | **Met** | All products have Ross-style taglines |
| Every product has `description` | **Met** | All products have descriptions |
| Every product has `priority` | **Met** | All products have priority 1-3 |
| Every product has `priceRange` | **Met** | All products have priceRange with min/max/currency |
| Every product has `regionLinks` | **Partially Met** | See issues below |
| Every product has `imageUrl` | **Met** | All products have Unsplash URLs |
| No duplicate product IDs | **Met** | 73 unique product IDs confirmed |
| All imageUrls are valid Unsplash URLs | **Met** | All use `images.unsplash.com` format |

### 5. Affiliate Link Structure

| Requirement | Status | Details |

**buildAmazonUrl Function Analysis (Lines 167-173):**
```typescript
export function buildAmazonUrl(
  asin: string,
  region: Region
): string {
  const config = REGION_CONFIGS[region];
  return `https://www.${config.amazonDomain}/dp/${asin}?tag=${config.affiliateTag}`;
}
```

**Output format:** `https://www.amazon.com/dp/B091G5CH14?tag=looksmaxx-20`

This is the correct Amazon affiliate URL format.

---

## Detailed Findings

### Issue 1: Missing Region Links (Priority: High)

**File:** `/Users/imorgado/LOOKSMAXX/looksmaxx-app/src/data/guides/products-registry.ts`

**Description:** 22 products are missing one or more region links (fr, au primarily). While the buildRegionLinks helper falls back to US ASIN, users in France and Australia will be redirected to amazon.com instead of their local Amazon store.

**Impact:** Reduced affiliate conversion rates in EU and Australian markets.

toolUseResult.originalFile:
/**
 * Core & Neck Training Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const coreNeckGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'core-neck',
  slug: 'core-neck-training',
  title: 'Core & Neck Training',
  subtitle: "The overlooked muscles that change everything",
  description: "Build a solid core for posture and a thick neck for masculine presence. Both are underrated game-changers.",
  icon: 'Target',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 8,
  order: 6,
  tags: ['core', 'neck', 'posture', 'training', 'aesthetics'],
  relatedGuides: ['training', 'v-taper', 'body-fat'],
  productIds: ['creatine_mono'],
  forumCategory: 'height-frame',
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'Why Core and Neck Matter',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Two of the most overlooked muscle groups that have outsized impact on your appearance:

**The Neck:**
A thick neck makes your head look proportionate, adds masculinity, and completely changes how you're perceived. Think about the difference between a pencil neck and a football player neck. Night and day.

**The Core:**
Beyond aesthetics, a strong core improves posture, supports lifting heavy, and defines that V-taper from waist. Weak core = weak everything else.

Most guys skip both because:
- Neck training seems weird or unsafe
- Core work is boring (crunches in the corner)
- Neither is a "mirror muscle"

This is a mistake. Both are trainable, and both pay massive dividends.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'neck-benefits',
      title: 'Neck: The Masculine Multiplier',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `A thick neck is one of the most underrated aesthetic upgrades you can make:

**Visual Benefits:**
- Head looks proportionate to body
- Jawline appears stronger
- More masculine/dominant presence
- Fills out shirt collars
- Better photos from every angle

**Functional Benefits:**
- Reduced neck pain
- Better posture support
- Injury prevention (sports, accidents)
- Improved head position for mewing

**The Reality:**
Compare a skinny neck to a thick neck on the same person. It's a completely different look. Yet almost nobody trains it.

The neck is one of the fastest-growing muscle groups because most people have never trained it. You can add an inch to your neck in 2-3 months with consistent training.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'neck-anatomy',
      title: 'Neck Muscles to Train',
      humorLevel: 'low',
      content: `Understanding what you're training helps you train it better:

**Sternocleidomastoid (SCM)**
- The muscles on the front/sides of your neck
- Creates that "thick neck" look from the front
- Trained with neck curls and lateral flexion

**Trapezius (Upper Traps)**
- The muscles connecting neck to shoulders
- Creates width and thickness from behind
- Trained with shrugs and neck extensions

**Splenius (Deep Neck Extensors)**
- Muscles on the back of the neck
- Important for head position and posture
- Trained with neck extensions

**Scalenes**
- Side of neck, often tight from desk work
- Important for balanced development
- Trained with lateral neck flexion

**Training All Directions:**
The neck moves in four directions:
1. Flexion (chin to chest)
2. Extension (looking up)
3. Lateral flexion (ear to shoulder)
4. Rotation (turning head)

Train all of them for balanced development.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'neck-exercises',
      title: 'Neck Training Exercises',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Start with bodyweight, progress to resistance:

**Beginner: Manual Resistance (First 4 Weeks)**
Use your hands to provide resistance:

1. **Neck Curls (Flexion)**
   - Push forehead against palm
   - Resist and try to bring chin to chest
   - 3x10-15 each direction

2. **Neck Extensions**
   - Cup back of head with hands
   - Resist and try to look up
   - 3x10-15

3. **Lateral Flexion**
   - Hand on side of head
   - Resist and try to touch ear to shoulder
   - 3x10-15 each side

**Intermediate: Neck Harness/Plate (After 1 Month)**
1. **Weighted Neck Curls**
   - Lie face up on bench, head off edge
   - Hold plate on forehead
   - Curl chin to chest
   - 3x15-20

2. **Weighted Neck Extensions**
   - Lie face down on bench, head off edge
   - Plate on back of head (or neck harness)
   - Extend neck up
   - 3x15-20

3. **Neck Harness Extensions**
   - Best for progressive overload
   - Start light (5-10 lbs)
   - Build to 25-45+ lbs over months

**Advanced: Neck Curls Machine**
If your gym has one (rare), use it. Best equipment for neck training.`,
      tips: [
        'Start LIGHT—the neck is sensitive and untrained',
        'Progress slowly—add 2.5-5 lbs per week max',
        'Avoid jerky movements—slow and controlled always'
      ],
      warnings: [
        'Never roll the neck under load—risk of injury',
        "Don't train to absolute failure on neck exercises",
        'Stop immediately if you feel any sharp pain'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'neck-programming',
      title: 'Neck Training Program',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Here's a progressive neck training protocol:

**Phase 1: Manual Resistance (Weeks 1-4)**
- Frequency: 3x per week
- Duration: 5 minutes at end of workout
- All four directions, 2 sets each

**Phase 2: Light Weight (Weeks 5-8)**
- Add 2.5-5 lb plates
- Frequency: 2-3x per week
- 2-3 sets of 15-20 reps each direction
- Focus on mind-muscle connection

**Phase 3: Progressive Overload (Weeks 9+)**
- Increase weight when you hit 25 reps easily
- Work up to 3-4 sets of 15-20 reps
- 2x per week is sufficient at this stage

**Weekly Volume:**
- 6-12 sets per week is plenty
- Don't overtrain—neck recovers but can get sore easily
- Spread across 2-3 sessions

**Sample Session (10 Minutes):**
1. Neck Curls: 3x15-20
2. Neck Extensions: 3x15-20
3. Lateral Flexion: 2x15-20 each side

Add this at the end of any workout. It doesn't take long.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'core-fundamentals',
      title: 'Core: Beyond Crunches',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Your core is more than abs. It's the entire trunk stabilization system:

**Core Functions:**
1. **Anti-Extension** — Preventing back from arching (planks, ab wheel)
2. **Anti-Rotation** — Preventing torso twist (Pallof press)
3. **Anti-Lateral Flexion** — Preventing side bending (side planks, carries)
4. **Hip Flexion** — Bringing legs toward torso (leg raises)

**Why This Matters:**
Crunches only train one function (spinal flexion). A complete core routine trains all four. This builds functional strength that transfers to:
- Better posture
- Stronger lifts (squat, deadlift)
- Tighter waist appearance
- Reduced lower back pain

**The Ab Visibility Truth:**
You can do 1000 crunches but if you're at 20% body fat, you won't see your abs. Core training builds the muscle. Diet reveals it. Both are needed.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'core-exercises',
      title: 'Best Core Exercises',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Forget endless crunches. These exercises actually build a strong core:

**Anti-Extension:**
1. **Ab Wheel Rollouts** — The king of core exercises
2. **Plank Variations** — Start here if you're weak
3. **Dead Bug** — Coordination + stability

**Anti-Rotation:**
1. **Pallof Press** — Cable or band, squeeze and hold
2. **Single-Arm Carries** — Heavy dumbbell, walk straight
3. **Single-Arm Cable Rows** — Resist rotation while pulling

**Anti-Lateral Flexion:**
1. **Side Planks** — Basic but effective
2. **Suitcase Carries** — Heavy one-arm carry
3. **Copenhagen Planks** — Advanced, adductor + core

**Hip Flexion:**
1. **Hanging Leg Raises** — The best for lower abs
2. **Reverse Crunches** — Easier variation
3. **Lying Leg Raises** — Floor version

**The Vacuum:**
Not a strength exercise, but critical for waist control:
- Exhale fully
- Suck stomach in as hard as possible
- Hold 15-30 seconds
- Do daily, 5-10 reps`,
      tips: [
        'Ab wheel is brutally effective—start from knees',
        'Hanging leg raises are hard—use straps if grip fails',
        'Side planks should be felt in obliques, not hip'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'core-programming',
      title: 'Core Training Program',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Core can be trained frequently because the muscles recover fast:

**Option 1: Dedicated Core Days (2-3x/Week)**
Add 10-15 minutes of core work after upper body sessions:

- Ab Wheel Rollouts: 3x8-12
- Hanging Leg Raises: 3x10-15
- Pallof Press: 2x10-12 each side
- Side Plank: 2x30-45 sec each side

**Option 2: Integrated (Every Session)**
Add 1-2 core exercises to every workout:

- Day 1: Ab Wheel + Pallof Press
- Day 2: Leg Raises + Side Planks
- Day 3: Plank + Dead Bug
- Day 4: Repeat

**Option 3: Supersetting**
Between sets of other exercises:
- Superset Bench Press with Ab Wheel (during rest)
- Superset Squats with Dead Bug
- Efficient use of time

**Volume Guidelines:**
- 6-12 sets of direct core work per week
- Compounds (squats, deadlifts) also train core
- Don't overthink—consistency matters more than perfection

**Daily Vacuum Practice:**
- Morning, before eating: 5-10 vacuums, 15-30 sec holds
- This is cumulative—daily practice shrinks waist appearance`,
    },
    {
      id: 'obliques-warning',
      title: 'A Note on Oblique Training',
      humorLevel: 'medium-high',
      content: `Here's something most people get wrong:

**The Goal:**
A narrow waist and visible V-taper.

**The Mistake:**
Heavy weighted oblique exercises (side bends, wood chops with heavy weight).

**The Problem:**
Your obliques are muscles. If you train them with heavy resistance, they grow. Bigger obliques = wider waist. This is the opposite of what you want.

**The Solution:**
- Skip heavy direct oblique work entirely
- Obliques get enough stimulus from:
  - Compound lifts (squats, deadlifts)
  - Anti-rotation work (Pallof press)
  - Side planks (isometric, not hypertrophy-focused)

**For Most Guys:**
Never do weighted side bends. Never do heavy wood chops. Your obliques are probably already developed enough from other training. Adding size to them will widen your waist.

**Exception:**
If you're a competitive athlete who needs rotational power (golfer, baseball player), train obliques. For aesthetics? Skip the heavy stuff.`,
      warnings: [
        'Weighted side bends can increase waist width',
        'Obliques are often overdeveloped relative to needs',
        'V-taper requires a narrow waist, not thick obliques'
      ],
    },
    {
      id: 'action-plan',
      title: 'Your Action Plan',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Here's your complete core + neck upgrade plan:

**Week 1-4: Foundation**
- Neck: Manual resistance, 3x per week, 5 min each
- Core: Ab wheel + leg raises + side plank, 2x per week, 10 min each
- Vacuum: Daily, 5 holds of 20 seconds

**Week 5-8: Build**
- Neck: Add light weight (5-10 lbs), 3x per week
- Core: Progress to harder variations, add Pallof press
- Vacuum: 10 holds of 30 seconds

**Week 9+: Progress**
- Neck: Progressive overload, 2-3x per week, working toward 25+ lbs
- Core: Full routine, 2x per week, focus on getting stronger
- Vacuum: Maintenance, daily habit

**Expected Results:**
- Neck: 0.5-1 inch growth in first 2-3 months
- Core: Visible improvement in 4-6 weeks (if diet is right)
- Posture: Noticeable improvement in 2-4 weeks

**The Payoff:**
These are two of the highest-ROI muscle groups you can train. Minimal time investment, maximum visual and functional return. Don't skip them.`,
      products: ['creatine_mono'],
    },
  ],
};

/**
 * Cutting Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const cuttingGuideGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'cutting-guide',
  slug: 'cutting-guide',
  title: 'Cutting & Fat Loss',
  subtitle: "Get lean without losing your gains",
  description: "The science of fat loss done right—preserving muscle, managing hunger, and getting shredded sustainably.",
  icon: 'TrendingDown',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 5,
  order: 71,
  tags: ['cutting', 'fat-loss', 'diet', 'deficit', 'lean'],
  relatedGuides: ['nutrition-basics', 'body-fat-basics', 'cardio'],
  productIds: ['food_scale', 'magnesium_glycinate'],
  forumCategory: 'nutrition',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'cutting-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1490645935967-10de6ba17061?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Lean physique nutrition',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Cut Setup',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Fat loss is simple but not easy. Here's how to do it without destroying your hormones, muscle, or sanity.

**The Formula:**
Caloric deficit + high protein + resistance training = fat loss with muscle retention

**The Numbers:**
- Deficit: 300-500 calories below maintenance
- Protein: 1g per pound bodyweight (non-negotiable)
- Rate: 0.5-1% of bodyweight per week

**Why Moderate Deficits Win:**
- Aggressive cuts = more muscle loss
- Aggressive cuts = worse hormone response
- Aggressive cuts = harder to sustain
- Moderate cuts compound over weeks into significant fat loss`,
    },
    {
      id: 'setup',
      title: 'Setting Up Your Cut',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Step 1: Find Maintenance**
Track food for 1 week at stable weight. That's your maintenance.

**Step 2: Create Deficit**
Subtract 300-500 calories from maintenance.

**Step 3: Set Macros**
- Protein: 1g/lb (protect muscle)
- Fat: 0.3g/lb minimum (hormones)
- Carbs: remaining calories

**Step 4: Track Progress**
- Weigh daily, average weekly
- Take progress photos bi-weekly
- Measurements monthly

**Target Rate:**
- 0.5-1lb per week
- Faster = likely losing muscle
- Slower = might need to reduce calories more`,
    },
    {
      id: 'volume-eating',
      title: 'Volume Eating & Hunger Management',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**The Secret to Sustainable Cutting: Volume Eating**

Eat foods that fill you up without many calories.

**High Volume, Low Calorie Foods:**
- Vegetables (unlimited basically)
- Egg whites
- Lean proteins (chicken breast, white fish)
- Fruits (especially berries)
- Popcorn (air-popped)
- Clear soups

**Satiety Hacks:**
- Start meals with vegetables or soup
- Drink water before and during meals
- Eat protein first
- Slow down (takes 20 min to feel full)
- Use smaller plates

**Managing Hunger:**
- Some hunger is normal during a cut
- Constant extreme hunger = deficit too aggressive
- If starving all day, add 100-200 calories back`,
    },
    {
      id: 'mistakes',
      title: 'Common Cutting Mistakes',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Mistake 1: Cutting Too Aggressively**
More than 1% bodyweight per week = muscle loss territory.

**Mistake 2: Not Enough Protein**
Protein protects muscle. Skimp on it and you'll look worse, not better.

**Mistake 3: Dropping Calories Too Fast**
Start moderate. You can always reduce more later. Can't undo metabolic adaptation.

**Mistake 4: Too Much Cardio**
Cardio helps but isn't required. If you're doing 2 hours daily, something's wrong with your diet.

**Mistake 5: Weekend Blowouts**
One big cheat day can erase a week of deficit. Controlled refeeds > binges.

**Mistake 6: Neglecting Training**
Keep lifting heavy. Muscle retention requires stimulus. Don't switch to "toning" workouts.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'action-plan',
      title: 'Your Cutting Protocol',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Week 1-2: Setup**
- Calculate maintenance and set 400cal deficit
- Hit 1g/lb protein daily
- Track everything

**Weeks 3-8: Execute**
- Target 0.5-1lb loss per week
- Adjust calories every 2-3 weeks if stalled
- Keep training intensity high

**When to Add Cardio:**
- Start with diet only
- Add 2-3 sessions of 20-30min LISS when progress stalls
- Don't exceed 4-5 sessions weekly

**When to Take a Break:**
- After 8-12 weeks of cutting
- If energy/libido crash
- Diet break: eat at maintenance for 1-2 weeks

**End Goal:**
- Get to 10-15% body fat
- Then transition to maintenance or lean bulk
- Don't cut indefinitely

**The Payoff:**
A proper cut reveals the muscle you've built. It's where all your work becomes visible.`,
    },
  ],
};

/**
 * Toxic Swaps Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const toxicSwapsGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'toxic-swaps',
  slug: 'toxic-swaps',
  title: 'Toxic to Safe Swaps',
  subtitle: "Don't overthink it—just swap these and you're done",
  description: "Simple product swaps that eliminate 95% of environmental toxin exposure without changing your lifestyle.",
  icon: 'RefreshCw',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 4,
  order: 41,
  tags: ['toxins', 'swaps', 'products', 'environment', 'biohacking'],
  relatedGuides: ['toxins-aesthetics', 'environmental-stress', 'skincare-basics'],
  productIds: ['water_jug', 'cerave_cleanser', 'cerave_moisturizer'],
  forumCategory: 'lifestyle',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'toxic-swaps-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1558618666-fcd25c85cd64?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Safe product alternatives',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'Simple Swaps, Big Impact',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Don't overthink it—just swap these and you're done.

**The Philosophy:**
You don't need to become a hippie. You just need to remove the obvious endocrine disruptors from daily use.

**The Result:**
- Better skin clarity
- Reduced breakouts
- Less water retention
- Better sleep
- Improved recovery
- Better hormone function

This directly improves skin clarity + reduces breakouts.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'water-storage',
      title: '1. Water & Storage Swaps',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**This is 95% of the ROI.**

| Toxic | Safe Swap |
|-------|-----------|
| Plastic water bottle | Glass water bottle (no plastic) |
| Plastic shaker | Stainless steel shaker |
| Plastic Tupperware | Glass food containers |
| Plastic in microwave | Glass or ceramic only |

**Why It Matters:**
Plastic leaches xenoestrogens, especially when heated. Every time you drink from a plastic bottle that's been in a hot car or microwave plastic, you're dosing yourself with endocrine disruptors.

**The Fix:**
- Get a glass or stainless water bottle ($15-30)
- Replace plastic food storage gradually
- Never heat plastic, ever

**ROI:** Less bloat, better testosterone, clearer skin.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'grooming-hygiene',
      title: '2. Grooming & Hygiene Swaps',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**This directly improves skin clarity + reduces breakouts.**

| Toxic | Safe Swap |
|-------|-----------|
| Fragrance deodorant | Aluminum-free deodorant |
| Cheap body wash | Fragrance-free formula |
| Scented lotion | Smoother skincare formulas (no synthetic fragrance) |
| Body spray | Nothing (or essential oil-based) |

**The Problem:**
"Fragrance" on a label means a proprietary blend of potentially dozens of chemicals. Many are endocrine disruptors.

**Avoid:**
- Cheap body washes that strip your skin microbiome
- Synthetic fragrances (especially body sprays)
- Products with long ingredient lists of unpronounceable chemicals

**The Fix:**
- Switch to fragrance-free versions of what you already use
- Check ingredient lists—fewer = better
- Prioritize products labeled "unscented" or "fragrance-free"`,
    },
    {
      id: 'cooking-prep',
      title: '3. Cooking & Food Prep Swaps',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**This alone reduces internal inflammation.**

| Toxic | Safe Swap |
|-------|-----------|
| Non-stick (Teflon) | Stainless steel pan |
| Aluminum cookware | Cast iron skillet |
| Plastic spatulas | Wooden spatula (avoid melting plastic spatulas) |
| Scratched pans | Replace immediately |

**The Problem:**
- Scratched Teflon releases microplastics into food
- Overheated non-stick releases toxic fumes
- Cheap cookware can leach metals

**The Fix:**
- Stainless steel for most cooking
- Cast iron for high-heat (and it adds iron to food)
- Stop using any scratched non-stick pans
- Wooden or silicone utensils

**Priority:** If you have scratched non-stick pans, throw them out today.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'air-sleep',
      title: '4. Air & Sleep Swaps',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Better air = better sleep = better recovery = better aesthetics.**

| Toxic | Safe Swap |
|-------|-----------|
| Scented candles | Beeswax candles or nothing |
| Air fresheners | Open windows |
| No air filtration | Small air purifier |
| Synthetic bedding | Cotton or bamboo sheets |

**The Fix:**
- Small air purifier in bedroom ($50-100)
- Clean sheets once a week
- Open windows for airflow
- Don't sleep in a room with mold or dampness
- Optional: Himalayan salt lamp for night lighting

**The Sleep Connection:**
Poor air quality directly affects sleep quality. Better air = deeper sleep = better recovery = tighter face.

**Signs Your Air Is Bad:**
- Wake up congested
- Stuffy nose at home but not elsewhere
- Dust buildup despite cleaning
- Musty smell`,
    },
    {
      id: 'checklist',
      title: 'Your Swap Checklist',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Do This Week:**
- [ ] Get glass or stainless water bottle
- [ ] Stop microwaving plastic
- [ ] Throw out scratched non-stick pans

**Do This Month:**
- [ ] Switch to fragrance-free deodorant
- [ ] Switch to fragrance-free body wash
- [ ] Get a basic water filter
- [ ] Replace 1-2 plastic containers with glass

**Do When Convenient:**
- [ ] Get bedroom air purifier
- [ ] Switch to cast iron or stainless cookware
- [ ] Audit all grooming products

**Total Investment:** ~$100-200 for all priority swaps

**The Philosophy:**
You're not trying to live in a bubble. You're just removing the obvious offenders that have outsized negative effects.

Swap, forget about it, and enjoy the benefits automatically.`,
    },
  ],
};

/**
 * Testosterone Nutrition Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const testosteroneNutritionGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'testosterone-nutrition',
  slug: 'testosterone-nutrition',
  title: 'Nutrition for Testosterone',
  subtitle: "Your T levels follow your body fat and micronutrients",
  description: "How body fat percentage, macros, and micronutrients directly affect testosterone production and hormonal health.",
  icon: 'Apple',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 5,
  order: 31,
  tags: ['testosterone', 'nutrition', 'body-fat', 'diet', 'micronutrients'],

/**
 * Debloating Protocol Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const debloatingProtocolGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'debloating-protocol',
  slug: 'debloating-protocol',
  title: 'The Debloating Protocol',
  subtitle: "Look tighter in 24-72 hours",
  description: "How to reduce water retention, bloating, and puffiness for a sharper, more defined appearance.",
  icon: 'Droplets',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 5,
  order: 75,
  tags: ['debloating', 'water-retention', 'bloating', 'aesthetics', 'puffiness'],
  relatedGuides: ['water-retention', 'cortisol-management', 'body-fat-basics'],
  productIds: ['magnesium_glycinate'],
  forumCategory: 'lifestyle',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'debloating-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1490645935967-10de6ba17061?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Lean defined physique',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'Why You Look Puffy',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `You're not as fat as you think—you're probably just holding water.

**Common Causes of Bloating/Puffiness:**
- High sodium intake
- Low water intake (paradoxically)
- High carb intake (glycogen holds water)
- Poor sleep
- High cortisol/stress
- Food sensitivities
- Alcohol
- Hormonal fluctuations

**The Reality:**
2-8 lbs of your "weight" is water. This can make you look dramatically different day-to-day without any actual fat change.

**The Goal:**
Reduce unnecessary water retention for a tighter, more defined appearance.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'quick-protocol',
      title: 'The 24-72 Hour Protocol',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**For a quick debloat (before event, photoshoot, etc.):**

**Day 1-2:**
- Increase water intake to 1 gallon+
- Reduce sodium to <1500mg
- Cut carbs to <50g
- No alcohol
- No dairy (if sensitive)
- No artificial sweeteners

**Day 3 (Event Day):**
- Moderate water (normal intake)
- Very low sodium
- Low carbs until event
- Small carb meal 2-3 hours before (optional pump)

**What Happens:**
- High water + low sodium = body flushes water
- Low carbs = glycogen depletes, releasing water
- Reduced inflammation = less puffiness

**Warning:**
This is for short-term aesthetics. Don't do this constantly—it's not sustainable or healthy long-term.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'daily-protocol',
      title: 'Daily Anti-Bloat Protocol',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**For ongoing reduction in water retention:**

**Hydration:**
- Drink 3-4L water daily (more = body holds less)
- Add electrolytes (paradoxically reduces retention)
- Front-load water earlier in day

**Sodium:**
- Keep consistent (not too low, not too high)
- Avoid huge spikes (processed foods, restaurant meals)
- 2000-3000mg is fine for active people

**Carbs:**
- Moderate, consistent intake
- Avoid huge swings (low all week, binge on weekend)
- Each gram of carb holds 3-4g water

**Sleep:**
- 7-9 hours
- Poor sleep = cortisol = water retention

**Stress:**
- Manage cortisol (see cortisol guide)
- High stress = puffy face`,
      products: ['magnesium_glycinate'],
    },
    {
      id: 'supplements',
      title: 'Debloating Supplements',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Actually Work:**

**Dandelion Root**
- Natural diuretic
- 500-1500mg daily
- Don't use long-term

**Potassium**
- Balances sodium
- Get from food (bananas, potatoes) or supplement
- 3500-4700mg daily total

**Magnesium**
- Reduces water retention
- 200-400mg glycinate before bed

**Vitamin B6**
- Mild diuretic effect
- 50-100mg daily
- Especially helpful for hormonal bloating

**What Doesn't Work:**
- "Detox teas" (just make you poop)
- Most fat burners
- Waist trainers (lol)

**Warning:**
Don't abuse diuretics. They can cause electrolyte imbalances and are not sustainable.`,
      products: ['magnesium_glycinate'],
    },
    {
      id: 'food-triggers',
      title: 'Identify Your Triggers',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Common Bloating Triggers:**

**Dairy**
- Lactose intolerance is common
- Try eliminating for 1 week

**Gluten**
- Some people are sensitive (not celiac)
- Try eliminating for 1 week

**Artificial Sweeteners**
- Sugar alcohols especially (sorbitol, maltitol)
- Can cause gas and bloating

**FODMAPs**
- Fermentable carbs
- Beans, onions, garlic, certain fruits
- May cause bloating in sensitive individuals

**Carbonated Drinks**
- Literally putting gas in your stomach
- Switch to flat water

**How to Identify:**
1. Eliminate suspected trigger for 7-14 days
2. Note if bloating improves
3. Reintroduce and see if it returns
4. Keep a food diary

**The 80% Rule:**
For most people, the main triggers are: too much sodium, too little water, inconsistent carb intake, poor sleep, and stress.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'action-plan',
      title: 'Your Debloating Protocol',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**This Week (Baseline):**
- [ ] Increase water to 3-4L daily
- [ ] Track sodium (aim for consistency)
- [ ] Sleep 7-9 hours
- [ ] Note which meals cause bloating

**Ongoing:**
- [ ] Keep carb intake consistent (no huge swings)
- [ ] Limit alcohol
- [ ] Manage stress/cortisol
- [ ] Consider eliminating dairy/gluten trial

**Before Events:**
- [ ] 48-72 hour protocol (high water, low sodium, low carb)
- [ ] Reduce water day-of slightly
- [ ] Small carb meal before for pump (optional)

**Supplement Stack (Optional):**
- Magnesium: 200-400mg nightly
- Potassium: From food primarily
- Dandelion root: Short-term use only

**The Payoff:**
Consistent hydration + consistent sodium + good sleep + managed stress = you'll naturally hold less water and look tighter day-to-day.

Most of the variation in how you look is water, not fat. Control the water, control your appearance.`,
      products: ['magnesium_glycinate'],
    },
  ],
};

/**
 * Estrogen Balance Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const estrogenBalanceGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'estrogen-balance',
  slug: 'estrogen-balance',
  title: 'Estrogen & Testosterone Balance',
  subtitle: "It's about the ratio, not just total T",
  description: "How to optimize your testosterone-to-estrogen ratio for masculine development, fat loss, and better aesthetics.",
  icon: 'Scale',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 4,
  order: 33,
  tags: ['estrogen', 'testosterone', 'hormones', 'aromatase', 'balance'],
  relatedGuides: ['testosterone-lifestyle', 'testosterone-nutrition', 'body-fat-basics'],
  productIds: ['zinc', 'vitamin_d3_k2'],
  forumCategory: 'lifestyle',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'estrogen-balance-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1571019614242-c5c5dee9f50b?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Hormonal balance',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Ratio Matters More Than Total T',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Most guys focus on boosting testosterone. What they should focus on is the **testosterone-to-estrogen ratio**.

**Why the Ratio Matters:**
- You can have high total testosterone but also high estrogen
- This leads to symptoms of low T despite "good" numbers
- Water retention, fat storage, gyno risk, low libido

**The Goal:**
High testosterone + appropriately low estrogen = optimal masculine function

**Signs of High Estrogen:**
- Water retention (puffy face, bloated midsection)
- Fat storage in chest and hips
- Low libido despite "normal" T levels
- Mood swings, irritability
- Soft muscles despite training`,
    },
    {
      id: 'aromatase',
      title: 'Understanding Aromatase',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Aromatase** is the enzyme that converts testosterone to estrogen.

**Where Aromatase Lives:**
- Fat cells (especially visceral and chest fat)
- More body fat = more aromatase = more conversion

**The Vicious Cycle:**
1. High body fat → high aromatase
2. High aromatase → more T converts to estrogen
3. High estrogen → more fat storage
4. More fat → even more aromatase

**Breaking the Cycle:**
Lower body fat = less aromatase = better T:E ratio

This is why getting lean should be priority #1 for hormonal optimization.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'reduce-estrogen',
      title: 'How to Reduce Estrogen Load',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**1. Lower Body Fat**
This is 80% of the solution. Get to 12-15% and aromatase activity drops significantly.

**2. Remove Xenoestrogens**
Environmental estrogen mimics:
- Plastics (especially heated)
- Fragrance products
- Non-stick cookware
- Conventional dairy and meat (sometimes)
- Soy products (in excess)

**3. Support Estrogen Metabolism**
Foods that help clear estrogen:
- Cruciferous vegetables (broccoli, cauliflower, Brussels sprouts)
- Contain DIM (diindolylmethane) which aids estrogen metabolism
- Eat 1-2 servings daily

**4. Avoid Alcohol**
Alcohol increases aromatase activity directly. Even moderate drinking shifts the ratio toward estrogen.

**5. Quality Sleep**
Poor sleep increases aromatase and cortisol, both of which worsen the T:E ratio.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'optimize-ratio',
      title: 'Optimizing the Ratio',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Natural Aromatase Inhibitors:**

**Zinc**
- Mild aromatase inhibition
- 15-30mg daily
- Don't mega-dose (can cause copper depletion)

**DIM (Diindolylmethane)**
- From cruciferous vegetables
- Helps metabolize estrogen
- Supplement: 100-200mg daily (or just eat your veggies)

**Grape Seed Extract**
- Mild aromatase inhibition
- 100-200mg daily

**Vitamin D**
- Supports healthy hormone production overall
- 2000-5000 IU daily

**What NOT to Do:**
- Don't take pharmaceutical AIs without medical supervision
- Don't try to crash estrogen to zero (you need some for joint health, libido, mood)
- Don't rely on supplements while ignoring body fat`,
      products: ['zinc', 'vitamin_d3_k2'],
    },
    {
      id: 'action-plan',
      title: 'Your Action Plan',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Priority Order:**

**Step 1: Get Lean (If Not Already)**
Target 12-15% body fat. This single change fixes the ratio for most guys.

**Step 2: Remove Xenoestrogens**
- Switch to glass/stainless containers
- Remove fragrance products
- Avoid heating plastic

**Step 3: Diet Adjustments**
- Cruciferous vegetables daily
- Minimize alcohol
- Avoid soy in excess

**Step 4: Supplement Support**
- Zinc: 15-30mg daily
- Vitamin D: 2000-5000 IU
- Consider DIM if eating few vegetables

**Step 5: Test If Curious**
Get bloodwork: Total T, Free T, Estradiol, SHBG

**The Goal:**
You don't need to obsess over numbers. If you're lean, eating well, sleeping well, and avoiding endocrine disruptors, your ratio will naturally optimize.

Most guys with "high estrogen" problems just have high body fat problems.`,
      products: ['zinc', 'vitamin_d3_k2'],
    },
  ],
};

/**
 * Nutrition Basics Guide
 * Humor Level: Medium (15%)
 */

import { Guide } from '@/types/guides';

export const nutritionBasicsGuide: Guide = {
  id: 'nutrition-basics',
  slug: 'nutrition-basics',
  title: 'Calories, Protein & Macros',
  subtitle: "The fundamentals that actually matter",
  description: "Everything you need to know about calories, protein, and macros for body composition—without the BS.",
  icon: 'Calculator',
  humorLevel: 'medium',
  estimatedReadTime: 5,
  order: 70,
  tags: ['nutrition', 'calories', 'protein', 'macros', 'diet'],
  relatedGuides: ['cutting-guide', 'bulking-guide', 'body-fat-basics'],
  productIds: ['protein_powder'],
  forumCategory: 'nutrition',
  heroMedia: {
    id: 'nutrition-basics-hero',
    type: 'image',
    url: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1490645935967-10de6ba17061?w=1200&q=80',
    alt: 'Healthy nutrition',
    placement: 'hero',
  },
  sections: [
    {
      id: 'intro',
      title: 'The Fundamentals',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `Nutrition doesn't have to be complicated. 90% of results come from these fundamentals:

1. **Calories** determine weight change (surplus = gain, deficit = lose)
2. **Protein** protects/builds muscle
3. **Everything else** is optimization

**The Hierarchy:**
1. Total calories (most important)
2. Protein intake
3. Food quality
4. Meal timing (least important)

Get the top two right and you'll get 80% of the results. The rest is fine-tuning.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'calories',
      title: 'Calories: The Foundation',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**The Math:**
- Maintenance = your bodyweight × 14-16 (depends on activity)
- Fat loss = maintenance - 300 to 500 calories
- Muscle gain = maintenance + 200 to 300 calories

**Finding Your Maintenance:**
1. Track food for 1 week at current intake
2. Track weight daily
3. If weight stable = that's maintenance
4. If gaining = you're above maintenance
5. If losing = you're below maintenance

**Why Counting Works:**
Most people dramatically underestimate calories eaten and overestimate calories burned. Tracking eliminates the guesswork.

**Why Counting Isn't Forever:**
Once you learn portion sizes and develop habits, you can transition to intuitive eating. But learn the fundamentals first.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'protein',
      title: 'Protein: The Priority',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Target: 0.8-1g per pound of bodyweight**

This is the most important macro for body composition.

**Why Protein Matters:**
- Builds and maintains muscle
- Most satiating macro (keeps you full)
- Highest thermic effect (burns calories during digestion)
- Protects muscle during fat loss

**Hitting It Daily:**
- Each meal should have a protein source
- 30-50g per meal, 3-4 meals
- Fill gaps with protein shakes if needed
- Front-load protein earlier in day for satiety

**Best Sources:**
- Chicken, turkey, lean beef
- Fish, eggs
- Greek yogurt, cottage cheese
- Protein powder (supplement, not replacement)`,
      products: ['protein_powder'],
    },
    {
      id: 'other-macros',
      title: 'Carbs & Fats',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `After protein, fill remaining calories with carbs and fats based on preference.

**Minimum Fat:** 0.3-0.4g per pound bodyweight
Fat is essential for hormones. Don't go below this.

**Carbs:** Whatever's left after protein and fat
Carbs fuel training and fill out muscles. Not the enemy.

**Practical Split:**
| Goal | Protein | Fat | Carbs |
|------|---------|-----|-------|
| Fat Loss | 1g/lb | 0.3-0.4g/lb | Fill remaining |
| Maintenance | 0.8-1g/lb | 0.4g/lb | Fill remaining |
| Muscle Gain | 1g/lb | 0.4g/lb | Higher carbs |

**The Reality:**
As long as protein and calories are right, the carb/fat ratio is personal preference. Some people feel better with more carbs, others with more fats.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'food-quality',
      title: 'Food Quality',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**80% whole foods, 20% whatever**

You don't need to be perfect. You need to be consistent.

**Prioritize:**
- Protein from animal sources
- Vegetables with most meals
- Fruits, whole grains, legumes
- Healthy fats (olive oil, avocado, nuts)

**Minimize:**
- Processed foods (chips, cookies, fast food)
- Seed oils (vegetable oil, canola)
- Added sugars
- Ultra-processed snacks

**Why Quality Matters:**
- Better nutrient density
- Better satiety (stay fuller longer)
- Better hormone function
- Less inflammation

**But Also:**
A 90% clean diet with occasional treats is more sustainable than 100% clean with weekly binges.`,
    },
    {
      id: 'action-plan',
      title: 'Your Nutrition Setup',
      humorLevel: 'medium',
      content: `**Step 1: Calculate Your Numbers**
- Maintenance: bodyweight × 15
- Protein: bodyweight × 1g
- Fat: bodyweight × 0.4g
- Carbs: remaining calories ÷ 4

**Step 2: Track for 2 Weeks**
Use MyFitnessPal or similar. Don't change anything yet—just observe.

**Step 3: Adjust Based on Goals**
- Want to lose fat? Subtract 300-500 cal from maintenance
- Want to gain muscle? Add 200-300 cal to maintenance
- Protein stays the same either way

**Step 4: Evaluate Weekly**
- Weigh daily, average weekly
- Losing 0.5-1lb/week? Good cut
- Gaining 0.25-0.5lb/week? Good bulk
- Adjust calories as needed

**The Mindset:**
This isn't a diet—it's learning how food works. Once you understand the fundamentals, you can navigate any situation.`,
    },
  ],
};

toolUseResult.originalFile:
/**
 * Product Registry for Guides System
 * 73 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
 * Categories: hygiene, grooming, skincare, miscellaneous, supplements, hair, beard, teeth, kbeauty, hormonal, surgery
 */

import { GuideProduct, ProductCategory } from '@/types/guides';
import { buildAmazonUrl } from '@/lib/region';

// ============================================
// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
// ============================================

interface ProductASINs {
  us?: string;
  uk?: string;
  de?: string;
  fr?: string;
  au?: string;
}

// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];

// Helper to build region links from ASINs
function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
  const links: Record<string, string> = {};

  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    if (asin) {
      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    }
  });

  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
  if (asins.us) {
    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
  }

  return links;
}

// ============================================
// PRODUCT DATABASE (33 Products)
// ============================================

export const GUIDE_PRODUCTS: GuideProduct[] = [
  // ============================================
  // HYGIENE (4 products)
  // ============================================

    description: 'Medical-grade stainless steel tongue scraper. Removes bacteria and sulfur compounds that cause bad breath. Takes 10 seconds, lasts forever.',
    priority: 1,
    priceRange: { min: 7, max: 12, currency: 'USD' },
    regionLinks: buildRegionLinks({
      us: 'B091G5CH14',
      uk: 'B091G5CH14',
      de: 'B091G5CH14',
      fr: 'B091G5CH14',
      au: 'B091G5CH14',
    }),
    imageUrl: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1609587312208-cea54be969e7?w=200&h=200&fit=crop',
    isBaseStack: true,
  },
  {
    id: 'cologne_bleu',
    name: 'Bleu de Chanel EDT',
    brand: 'Chanel',
    category: 'hygiene',
    tagline: "Stop smelling like your high school gym locker. This ain't Axe bodyspray era anymore.",
    description: 'Clean, versatile, universally liked. The safe choice that works for 99% of situations. Not cheap, but compliment-to-dollar ratio is unmatched.',
    priority: 2,
    priceRange: { min: 80, max: 150, currency: 'USD' },
    regionLinks: buildRegionLinks({
      us: 'B01N4P3WC3',
      uk: 'B01N4P3WC3',
      de: 'B01N4P3WC3',
      fr: 'B01N4P3WC3',
      au: 'B01N4P3WC3',
    }),
    imageUrl: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1541643600914-78b084683601?w=200&h=200&fit=crop',
    isBaseStack: false,
  },
  {
    id: 'nitrile_gloves',
    name: 'Nitrile Examination Gloves',
    brand: 'Dealmed',
    category: 'hygiene',
    tagline: "For when you're touching your face with tretinoin hands. Your pillowcase will thank you.",
    description: 'Black nitrile gloves for skincare application. Prevents product waste and keeps actives off your hands.',
    priority: 3,
    priceRange: { min: 12, max: 20, currency: 'USD' },
    regionLinks: buildRegionLinks({
      us: 'B08BZNM84F',
      uk: 'B08BZNM84F',
      de: 'B08BZNM84F',
      fr: 'B08BZNM84F',
      au: 'B08BZNM84F',
    }),
    imageUrl: 'https://images.unsplash.com/photo-1584820927498-cfe5211fd8bf?w=200&h=200&fit=crop',
    isBaseStack: false,
  },

// ============================================
// HELPER FUNCTIONS
// ============================================

/**
 * Product ID aliases for backwards compatibility
 * Maps shorthand IDs to full product IDs
 */
const PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES: Record<string, string> = {
  // Supplements
  ashwagandha: 'ashwagandha_ksm66',
  creatine: 'creatine_mono',
  omega_3: 'omega3_fish_oil',
  zinc: 'zinc_picolinate',
  // Add more as needed
};

/**
 * Get product by ID (supports aliases)
 */
export function getGuideProductById(id: string): GuideProduct | undefined {
  // Resolve alias if it exists
  const resolvedId = PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES[id] || id;
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.find(p => p.id === resolvedId);
}

/**
 * Get all products in a category
 */
export function getGuideProductsByCategory(category: ProductCategory): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.category === category)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get all base stack products (essentials for everyone)
 */
export function getBaseStackProducts(): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.isBaseStack)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get products by priority level
 */
export function getGuideProductsByPriority(priority: number): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.priority === priority);
}

/**
 * Get all unique categories with product counts
 */
export function getProductCategories(): Array<{ category: ProductCategory; count: number }> {
  const categories: ProductCategory[] = [
    'hygiene',
    'grooming',
    'skincare',
    'miscellaneous',
    'supplements',
    'hair',
    'beard',
    'teeth',
    'kbeauty',
    'hormonal',
    'surgery',
  ];

  return categories.map(category => ({
    category,
    count: GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.category === category).length,
  }));
}

/**
 * Get products by array of IDs (preserves order)
 */
export function getGuideProductsByIds(ids: string[]): GuideProduct[] {
  return ids
    .map(id => getGuideProductById(id))
    .filter((p): p is GuideProduct => p !== undefined);
}

/**
 * Search products by name or description
 */
export function searchGuideProducts(query: string): GuideProduct[] {
  const lowered = query.toLowerCase();
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p =>
    p.name.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.description.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.tagline.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    (p.brand && p.brand.toLowerCase().includes(lowered))
  );
}

/**
 * Get total product count
 */
export function getTotalProductCount(): number {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.length;
}

/**
 * Get category display info
 */
export function getCategoryDisplayInfo(category: ProductCategory): {
  name: string;
  icon: string;
  description: string;
} {
  const info: Record<ProductCategory, { name: string; icon: string; description: string }> = {
    hygiene: {
      name: 'Hygiene',
      icon: 'Sparkles',
      description: 'Fundamentals of not repelling people',
    },
    grooming: {
      name: 'Grooming',
      icon: 'Scissors',
      description: 'Tools for precision face maintenance',
    },
    skincare: {
      name: 'Skincare',
      icon: 'Droplet',
      description: 'Your skin is your face. Treat it right.',
    },
    miscellaneous: {
      name: 'Miscellaneous',
      icon: 'Package',
      description: 'The supporting cast of your glow-up',
    },
    supplements: {
      name: 'Supplements',
      icon: 'Pill',
      description: 'Fill the gaps your diet is missing',
    },
    hair: {
      name: 'Hair',
      icon: 'Wind',
      description: 'The Big 3 and beyond—save what you have',
    },
    beard: {
      name: 'Beard',
      icon: 'User',
      description: 'Grow it, groom it, own it',
    },
    teeth: {
      name: 'Teeth',
      icon: 'Smile',
      description: 'Your smile is worth more than you think',
    },
    kbeauty: {
      name: 'K-Beauty',
      icon: 'Sparkle',
      description: 'Glass skin protocols from Seoul',
    },
    hormonal: {
      name: 'Hormonal',
      icon: 'Heart',
      description: 'PCOS, hormonal acne, and balance',
    },
    surgery: {
      name: 'Surgery',
      icon: 'Stethoscope',
      description: 'Post-op recovery essentials',
    },
  };

  return info[category];
}

/**
 * Product Registry for Guides System
 * 73 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
 * Categories: hygiene, grooming, skincare, miscellaneous, supplements, hair, beard, teeth, kbeauty, hormonal, surgery
 */

import { GuideProduct, ProductCategory } from '@/types/guides';
import { buildAmazonUrl } from '@/lib/region';

// ============================================
// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
// ============================================

interface ProductASINs {
  us?: string;
  uk?: string;
  de?: string;
  fr?: string;
  au?: string;
}

// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];

// Helper to build region links from ASINs
function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
  const links: Record<string, string> = {};

  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    if (asin) {
      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    }
  });

  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
  if (asins.us) {
    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
  }

  return links;
}

// ============================================
// HELPER FUNCTIONS
// ============================================

/**
 * Product ID aliases for backwards compatibility
 * Maps shorthand IDs to full product IDs
 */
const PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES: Record<string, string> = {
  // Supplements
  ashwagandha: 'ashwagandha_ksm66',
  creatine: 'creatine_mono',
  omega_3: 'omega3_fish_oil',
  zinc: 'zinc_picolinate',
  // Add more as needed
};

/**
 * Get product by ID (supports aliases)
 */
export function getGuideProductById(id: string): GuideProduct | undefined {
  // Resolve alias if it exists
  const resolvedId = PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES[id] || id;
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.find(p => p.id === resolvedId);
}

/**
 * Get all products in a category
 */
export function getGuideProductsByCategory(category: ProductCategory): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.category === category)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get all base stack products (essentials for everyone)
 */
export function getBaseStackProducts(): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.isBaseStack)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get products by priority level
 */
export function getGuideProductsByPriority(priority: number): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.priority === priority);
}

/**
 * Get all unique categories with product counts
 */
export function getProductCategories(): Array<{ category: ProductCategory; count: number }> {
  const categories: ProductCategory[] = [
    'hygiene',
    'grooming',
    'skincare',
    'miscellaneous',
    'supplements',
    'hair',
    'beard',
    'teeth',
    'kbeauty',
    'hormonal',
    'surgery',
  ];

  return categories.map(category => ({
    category,
    count: GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.category === category).length,
  }));
}

/**
 * Get products by array of IDs (preserves order)
 */
export function getGuideProductsByIds(ids: string[]): GuideProduct[] {
  return ids
    .map(id => getGuideProductById(id))
    .filter((p): p is GuideProduct => p !== undefined);
}

/**
 * Search products by name or description
 */
export function searchGuideProducts(query: string): GuideProduct[] {
  const lowered = query.toLowerCase();
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p =>
    p.name.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.description.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.tagline.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    (p.brand && p.brand.toLowerCase().includes(lowered))
  );
}

/**
 * Get total product count
 */
export function getTotalProductCount(): number {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.length;
}

/**
 * Get category display info
 */
export function getCategoryDisplayInfo(category: ProductCategory): {
  name: string;
  icon: string;
  description: string;
} {
  const info: Record<ProductCategory, { name: string; icon: string; description: string }> = {
    hygiene: {
      name: 'Hygiene',
      icon: 'Sparkles',
      description: 'Fundamentals of not repelling people',
    },
    grooming: {
      name: 'Grooming',
      icon: 'Scissors',
      description: 'Tools for precision face maintenance',
    },
    skincare: {
      name: 'Skincare',
      icon: 'Droplet',
      description: 'Your skin is your face. Treat it right.',
    },
    miscellaneous: {
      name: 'Miscellaneous',
      icon: 'Package',
      description: 'The supporting cast of your glow-up',
    },
    supplements: {
      name: 'Supplements',
      icon: 'Pill',
      description: 'Fill the gaps your diet is missing',
    },
    hair: {
      name: 'Hair',
      icon: 'Wind',
      description: 'The Big 3 and beyond—save what you have',
    },
    beard: {
      name: 'Beard',
      icon: 'User',
      description: 'Grow it, groom it, own it',
    },
    teeth: {
      name: 'Teeth',
      icon: 'Smile',
      description: 'Your smile is worth more than you think',
    },
    kbeauty: {
      name: 'K-Beauty',
      icon: 'Sparkle',
      description: 'Glass skin protocols from Seoul',
    },
    hormonal: {
      name: 'Hormonal',

      description: 'PCOS, hormonal acne, and balance',
    },
    surgery: {
      name: 'Surgery',
      icon: 'Stethoscope',
      description: 'Post-op recovery essentials',
    },
  };

  return info[category];
}

/**
 * Product Registry for Guides System
 * 73 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
 * Categories: hygiene, grooming, skincare, miscellaneous, supplements, hair, beard, teeth, kbeauty, hormonal, surgery
 */

import { GuideProduct, ProductCategory } from '@/types/guides';
import { buildAmazonUrl } from '@/lib/region';

// ============================================
// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
// ============================================

interface ProductASINs {
  us?: string;
  uk?: string;
  de?: string;
  fr?: string;
  au?: string;
}

// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];

// Helper to build region links from ASINs
function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
  const links: Record<string, string> = {};

  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    if (asin) {
      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    }
  });

  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
  if (asins.us) {
    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
  }

  return links;
}

// ============================================
// HELPER FUNCTIONS
// ============================================

/**
 * Product ID aliases for backwards compatibility
 * Maps shorthand IDs to full product IDs
 */
const PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES: Record<string, string> = {
  // Supplements
  ashwagandha: 'ashwagandha_ksm66',
  creatine: 'creatine_mono',
  omega_3: 'omega3_fish_oil',
  zinc: 'zinc_picolinate',
  // Add more as needed
};

/**
 * Get product by ID (supports aliases)
 */
export function getGuideProductById(id: string): GuideProduct | undefined {
  // Resolve alias if it exists
  const resolvedId = PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES[id] || id;
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.find(p => p.id === resolvedId);
}

/**
 * Get all products in a category
 */
export function getGuideProductsByCategory(category: ProductCategory): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.category === category)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get all base stack products (essentials for everyone)
 */
export function getBaseStackProducts(): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.isBaseStack)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get products by priority level
 */
export function getGuideProductsByPriority(priority: number): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.priority === priority);
}

/**
 * Get all unique categories with product counts
 */
export function getProductCategories(): Array<{ category: ProductCategory; count: number }> {
  const categories: ProductCategory[] = [
    'hygiene',
    'grooming',
    'skincare',
    'miscellaneous',
    'supplements',
    'hair',
    'beard',
    'teeth',
    'kbeauty',
    'hormonal',
    'surgery',
  ];

  return categories.map(category => ({
    category,
    count: GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.category === category).length,
  }));
}

/**
 * Get products by array of IDs (preserves order)
 */
export function getGuideProductsByIds(ids: string[]): GuideProduct[] {
  return ids
    .map(id => getGuideProductById(id))
    .filter((p): p is GuideProduct => p !== undefined);
}

/**
 * Search products by name or description
 */
export function searchGuideProducts(query: string): GuideProduct[] {
  const lowered = query.toLowerCase();
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p =>
    p.name.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.description.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.tagline.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    (p.brand && p.brand.toLowerCase().includes(lowered))
  );
}

/**
 * Get total product count
 */
export function getTotalProductCount(): number {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.length;
}

/**
 * Get category display info
 */
export function getCategoryDisplayInfo(category: ProductCategory): {
  name: string;
  icon: string;
  description: string;
} {
  const info: Record<ProductCategory, { name: string; icon: string; description: string }> = {
    hygiene: {
      name: 'Hygiene',
      icon: 'Sparkles',
      description: 'Fundamentals of not repelling people',
    },
    grooming: {
      name: 'Grooming',
      icon: 'Scissors',
      description: 'Tools for precision face maintenance',
    },
    skincare: {
      name: 'Skincare',
      icon: 'Droplet',
      description: 'Your skin is your face. Treat it right.',
    },
    miscellaneous: {
      name: 'Miscellaneous',
      icon: 'Package',
      description: 'The supporting cast of your glow-up',
    },
    supplements: {
      name: 'Supplements',
      icon: 'Pill',
      description: 'Fill the gaps your diet is missing',
    },
    hair: {
      name: 'Hair',
      icon: 'Wind',
      description: 'The Big 3 and beyond—save what you have',
    },
    beard: {
      name: 'Beard',
      icon: 'User',
      description: 'Grow it, groom it, own it',
    },
    teeth: {
      name: 'Teeth',
      icon: 'Smile',
      description: 'Your smile is worth more than you think',
    },
    kbeauty: {
      name: 'K-Beauty',
      icon: 'Sparkle',
      description: 'Glass skin protocols from Seoul',
    },
    hormonal: {
      name: 'Hormonal',

      description: 'PCOS, hormonal acne, and balance',
    },
    surgery: {
      name: 'Surgery',
      icon: 'Stethoscope',
      description: 'Post-op recovery essentials',
    },
  };

  return info[category];
}

/**
 * Product Registry for Guides System
 * 73 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
 * Categories: hygiene, grooming, skincare, miscellaneous, supplements, hair, beard, teeth, kbeauty, hormonal, surgery
 */

import { GuideProduct, ProductCategory } from '@/types/guides';
import { buildAmazonUrl } from '@/lib/region';

// ============================================
// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
// ============================================

interface ProductASINs {
  us?: string;
  uk?: string;
  de?: string;
  fr?: string;
  au?: string;
}

// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];

// Helper to build region links from ASINs
function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
  const links: Record<string, string> = {};

  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    if (asin) {
      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    }
  });

  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
  if (asins.us) {
    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
  }

  return links;
}

// ============================================
// HELPER FUNCTIONS
// ============================================

/**
 * Product ID aliases for backwards compatibility
 * Maps shorthand IDs to full product IDs
 */
const PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES: Record<string, string> = {
  // Supplements
  ashwagandha: 'ashwagandha_ksm66',
  creatine: 'creatine_mono',
  omega_3: 'omega3_fish_oil',
  zinc: 'zinc_picolinate',
  // Add more as needed
};

/**
 * Get product by ID (supports aliases)
 */
export function getGuideProductById(id: string): GuideProduct | undefined {
  // Resolve alias if it exists
  const resolvedId = PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES[id] || id;
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.find(p => p.id === resolvedId);
}

/**
 * Get all products in a category
 */
export function getGuideProductsByCategory(category: ProductCategory): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.category === category)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get all base stack products (essentials for everyone)
 */
export function getBaseStackProducts(): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.isBaseStack)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get products by priority level
 */
export function getGuideProductsByPriority(priority: number): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.priority === priority);
}

/**
 * Get all unique categories with product counts
 */
export function getProductCategories(): Array<{ category: ProductCategory; count: number }> {
  const categories: ProductCategory[] = [
    'hygiene',
    'grooming',
    'skincare',
    'miscellaneous',
    'supplements',
    'hair',
    'beard',
    'teeth',
    'kbeauty',
    'hormonal',
    'surgery',
  ];

  return categories.map(category => ({
    category,
    count: GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.category === category).length,
  }));
}

/**
 * Get products by array of IDs (preserves order)
 */
export function getGuideProductsByIds(ids: string[]): GuideProduct[] {
  return ids
    .map(id => getGuideProductById(id))
    .filter((p): p is GuideProduct => p !== undefined);
}

/**
 * Search products by name or description
 */
export function searchGuideProducts(query: string): GuideProduct[] {
  const lowered = query.toLowerCase();
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p =>
    p.name.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.description.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.tagline.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    (p.brand && p.brand.toLowerCase().includes(lowered))
  );
}

/**
 * Get total product count
 */
export function getTotalProductCount(): number {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.length;
}

/**
 * Get category display info
 */
export function getCategoryDisplayInfo(category: ProductCategory): {
  name: string;
  icon: string;
  description: string;
} {
  const info: Record<ProductCategory, { name: string; icon: string; description: string }> = {
    hygiene: {
      name: 'Hygiene',

    },
    hair: {

    },
    beard: {

      description: 'Grow it, groom it, own it',
    },
    teeth: {

    },
    kbeauty: {

    },
    hormonal: {

    },
    surgery: {

  return info[category];
}

/**
 * Product Registry for Guides System
 * 73 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
 * Categories: hygiene, grooming, skincare, miscellaneous, supplements, hair, beard, teeth, kbeauty, hormonal, surgery
 */

import { GuideProduct, ProductCategory } from '@/types/guides';
import { buildAmazonUrl } from '@/lib/region';

// ============================================
// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
// ============================================

interface ProductASINs {
  us?: string;
  uk?: string;
  de?: string;
  fr?: string;
  au?: string;
}

// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];

// Helper to build region links from ASINs
function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
  const links: Record<string, string> = {};

  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    if (asin) {
      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    }
  });

  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
  if (asins.us) {
    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
  }

  return links;
}

// ============================================
// HELPER FUNCTIONS
// ============================================

/**
 * Product ID aliases for backwards compatibility
 * Maps shorthand IDs to full product IDs
 */
const PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES: Record<string, string> = {
  // Supplements
  ashwagandha: 'ashwagandha_ksm66',
  creatine: 'creatine_mono',
  omega_3: 'omega3_fish_oil',
  zinc: 'zinc_picolinate',
  // Add more as needed
};

/**
 * Get product by ID (supports aliases)
 */
export function getGuideProductById(id: string): GuideProduct | undefined {
  // Resolve alias if it exists
  const resolvedId = PRODUCT_ID_ALIASES[id] || id;
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.find(p => p.id === resolvedId);
}

/**
 * Get all products in a category
 */
export function getGuideProductsByCategory(category: ProductCategory): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.category === category)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get all base stack products (essentials for everyone)
 */
export function getBaseStackProducts(): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS
    .filter(p => p.isBaseStack)
    .sort((a, b) => a.priority - b.priority);
}

/**
 * Get products by priority level
 */
export function getGuideProductsByPriority(priority: number): GuideProduct[] {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.priority === priority);
}

/**
 * Get all unique categories with product counts
 */
export function getProductCategories(): Array<{ category: ProductCategory; count: number }> {
  const categories: ProductCategory[] = [
    'hygiene',
    'grooming',
    'skincare',
    'miscellaneous',
    'supplements',
    'hair',
    'beard',
    'teeth',
    'kbeauty',
    'hormonal',
    'surgery',
  ];

  return categories.map(category => ({
    category,
    count: GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p => p.category === category).length,
  }));
}

/**
 * Get products by array of IDs (preserves order)
 */
export function getGuideProductsByIds(ids: string[]): GuideProduct[] {
  return ids
    .map(id => getGuideProductById(id))
    .filter((p): p is GuideProduct => p !== undefined);
}

/**
 * Search products by name or description
 */
export function searchGuideProducts(query: string): GuideProduct[] {
  const lowered = query.toLowerCase();
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.filter(p =>
    p.name.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.description.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    p.tagline.toLowerCase().includes(lowered) ||
    (p.brand && p.brand.toLowerCase().includes(lowered))
  );
}

/**
 * Get total product count
 */
export function getTotalProductCount(): number {
  return GUIDE_PRODUCTS.length;
}

/**
 * Get category display info
 */
export function getCategoryDisplayInfo(category: ProductCategory): {
  name: string;
  icon: string;
  description: string;
} {
  const info: Record<ProductCategory, { name: string; icon: string; description: string }> = {
    hygiene: {
      name: 'Hygiene',
      icon: 'Sparkles',
      description: 'Fundamentals of not repelling people',
    },
    grooming: {
      name: 'Grooming',
      icon: 'Scissors',
      description: 'Tools for precision face maintenance',
    },
    skincare: {
      name: 'Skincare',
      icon: 'Droplet',
      description: 'Your skin is your face. Treat it right.',
    },
    miscellaneous: {
      name: 'Miscellaneous',
      icon: 'Package',
      description: 'The supporting cast of your glow-up',
    },
    supplements: {
      name: 'Supplements',
      icon: 'Pill',
      description: 'Fill the gaps your diet is missing',
    },
    hair: {
      name: 'Hair',
      icon: 'Wind',
      description: 'The Big 3 and beyond—save what you have',
    },
    beard: {
      name: 'Beard',
      icon: 'User',
      description: 'Grow it, groom it, own it',
    },
    teeth: {
      name: 'Teeth',
      icon: 'Smile',
      description: 'Your smile is worth more than you think',
    },
    kbeauty: {
      name: 'K-Beauty',
      icon: 'Sparkle',
      description: 'Glass skin protocols from Seoul',
    },
    hormonal: {
      name: 'Hormonal',
      icon: 'Heart',
      description: 'PCOS, hormonal acne, and balance',
    },
    surgery: {
      name: 'Surgery',
      icon: 'Stethoscope',
      description: 'Post-op recovery essentials',
    },
  };

  return info[category];
}

toolUseResult.originalFile:
/**
 * Product Registry for Guides System
 * 73 products with multi-region affiliate links and Ross-style taglines
 * Categories: hygiene, grooming, skincare, miscellaneous, supplements, hair, beard, teeth, kbeauty, hormonal, surgery
 */

import { GuideProduct, ProductCategory } from '@/types/guides';
import { buildAmazonUrl } from '@/lib/region';

// ============================================
// AMAZON ASIN MAPPING BY REGION
// ============================================

interface ProductASINs {
  us?: string;
  uk?: string;
  de?: string;
  fr?: string;
  au?: string;
}

// Regions that have Amazon stores with ASINs
type AmazonRegion = 'us' | 'uk' | 'de' | 'fr' | 'au';
const AMAZON_REGIONS: AmazonRegion[] = ['us', 'uk', 'de', 'fr', 'au'];

// Helper to build region links from ASINs
function buildRegionLinks(asins: ProductASINs): Record<string, string> {
  const links: Record<string, string> = {};

  AMAZON_REGIONS.forEach(region => {
    const asin = asins[region] || asins.us; // Fallback to US ASIN
    if (asin) {
      links[region] = buildAmazonUrl(asin, region);
    }
  });

  // Asia uses US ASIN on amzn.asia domain
  if (asins.us) {
    links['asia'] = buildAmazonUrl(asins.us, 'asia');
  }

  return links;
}

// PRODUCT DATABASE (33 Products)
